intro: Pedicularis canadensis, commonly known as Canadian lousewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are showy, with bright red or orange petals and a distinctive spurred shape. It is often found in the northern regions of the United States and Canada.
